resource.name: COVID-19 Vaccination Demographics by County and District
resource.description:
Vaccination demographics data by county/region, by race, by ethnicity, by gender, and by age.

Fields with less than 5 results have been suppressed.
columns_description: County of residence, a value of Unknown indicates that a zip code of residence was not provided, Out of state indicates that when registering for vaccination an individual provided an out of state zip code of residence.

IDOH Health District ID, a value of Unknown indicates that a zip code of residence was not provided, Out of state indicates that when registering for vaccination an individual provided an out of state zip code of residence.

County of residence FIPS code, a value of Unknown indicates that a zip code of residence was not provided, Out of state indicates that when registering for vaccination an individual provided an out of state zip code of residence.
Total number of individuals who received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine
Total number of individuals who received their second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine
Total number of individuals who received a single dose COVID-19 vaccine.
Total number of doses administered. Include first dose, second dose, and single dose vaccines.
Total number of individuals who are considered to be fully vaccintaed for COVID-19
During the previous 24 hours of current_as_of date, number of individuals who received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine
During the previous 24 hours of current_as_of date, number of individuals who received their second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine
During the previous 24 hours of current_as_of date, number of individuals who receive a single dose COVID-19 vaccine.
During the previous 24 hours of current_as_of date, total number of doses administered, including first dose, second dose, and single dose vaccines.
During the previous 24 hours of current_as_of date, total number of individuals who are considered to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19
Date and time the data was reported to IDOH

resource.name: City of Bloomington Employee COVID Cases
resource.description: Reports of City of Bloomington employees with positive COVID-19 viral test results by department. The dataset also includes results from the municipal corporations of the Bloomington Housing Authority, Bloomington Transit, and the City of Bloomington Utilities. Note that results listed as "City Hall" include results from multiple departments whose employees work only at City Hall. These include: Community and Family Resources, Controller, Economic and Sustainable Development, Housing and Neighborhood Development, Human Resources, Information and Technology Services, Mayor's Office, Parks administration, and Public Works administration.

resource.name: Board and Commission Meeting Files
resource.description: Index of City board and commission documents: agendas, packets, minutes, and other related documents

resource.name: City of Bloomington Sars CoV-2 (COVID-19) Wastewater Monitoring
resource.description:
The City of Bloomington Utilities (CBU) in cooperation with the Indiana Finance Authority is participating in a monitoring program which tests wastewater for coronavirus. From August through December of 2020, wastewater professionals from CBU collected samples three times each week at eight sites across Bloomington, including each of the two wastewater treatment plants. Throughout 2021 samples have been collected from the two wastewater treatment plants. Testing of those samples is conducted by multiple private, independent laboratories in an effort to gauge viral prevalence in the community. 

More information about this process can be found in the Indiana Wastewater Monitoring Report 2020 at: 

https://data.bloomington.in.gov/dataset/cd07435a-adae-4ba6-b671-2b711227131d/resource/22b67271-e2d4-4789-af7d-4fc7a586071c/download/indiana-wastewater-monitoring-report-2020_bclear.pdf
columns_description: Location the sample was taken
Sample ID
Date the sample was taken
Composite or Grab Sampled
A "<" (less than) symbol means the sample was below the detection limit.
Gene copies per 100 ml of the sample.
